reviewText: This is quite possibly the worst $5 ive ever spent, the controls are awful and it only offers partial gamepad support. You don't even have to press any buttons to start rolling backwards in pre season. There is an option to configure controls but it was not detecting my gamepad. Seems like a mobile port.

reviewText:
3.2/10 - Mini Bikes Bring on Micro Fun!

This game could have been a winner with a few tweaks; however these didn't happen and you are left with a pretty poor racing game. The biggest complaint is the actual racing; if you fall behind the pack there is no chance of catching back up. This really sucks since there are interesting maps, power-ups different racing modes.

The game really got me excited with the power-ups; it reminded me of our beloved Mario Kart. The problem is if you aren't in a pack of racers you will never get to really utilize these power-ups since the map is so curvy and the other racers will already be half a lap in front of you. No controller support and barely enough keyboard customization.

Worth $0.20-0.30; just so you can make a profit with the cards.

reviewText: It's not a bad little game, controls are a little tricky to master but after a couple of races it's a piece of cake.\n\nThe only downside is the front lobe lobotomy AI players, no concievable race-line whatsoever, I always feel uneasy when lapping the slower bikes, get past 'em quick otherwise they'll crash into you because they have all the track etiquette of a seagull.

reviewText:
- Awful collision detection
- Moronic AI
- Terrible controls
- Bad physics
- Little controller support
- Poor optimization
- No online multiplayer
- Leaderboards don't work

However I am a big fan of MotoGP and the characters are cute. As much as I hate this game, the amount of time I've spent on it shows that I've found it fun.

Only play if you're a big MotoGP fan.
